questions.text: A 50-year-old patient undergoes gallbladder surgery. The surgeon accidentally damages the common bile duct but does not inform the patient. The patient later develops severe complications and sues the doctor. Which legal principle applies?
A doctor in a rural hospital administers an incorrect dose of potassium chloride IV, resulting in cardiac arrest and death of a patient. Under which BNS section can the doctor be prosecuted?
A patient sues a doctor for negligence after a surgical complication. The court finds that the doctor followed standard protocols, but the outcome was unfortunate. What is the likely verdict?
A police officer requests a post-mortem examination on an unknown body found near railway tracks. What type of inquest is conducted?
A doctor is summoned to court to provide expert testimony. If they fail to appear, what legal action can be taken?
A doctor refuses to treat an HIV-positive patient. This is an example of:
A 14-year-old boy arrives at a hospital needing an emergency appendectomy. Who can provide consent for the surgery?
A mentally ill patient is admitted involuntarily. Which legal document is required for admission?

options.label: B
options.text: Signed consent by a family member

questions.text: A woman undergoing a C-section is found to have an ovarian tumor. Can the surgeon remove the tumor without separate consent?
A patient dies due to an overdose of anesthesia. What type of negligence is this?
A hospital administrator orders a nurse to administer an experimental drug without informing the patient. Who is liable?

options.label: D
options.text: No one, as it is hospital protocol

questions.text: A burned body is recovered from a house fire. The bones are fragmented and charred beyond recognition. What is the best method for positive identification?
A severed hand is found at a crime scene. Which feature is most useful for identification?
A body is found in a forest, with bloating and greenish discoloration over the right iliac fossa. Marbling is evident. What is the likely time since death?
A victim of suspected poisoning is found with rectal temperature of 39 degree Celsius. Which of the following poisons is most likely?
During an autopsy of a suspected poisoning case, the stomach contents are greenish and emit a garlic odor. Which poison is suspected?
A fully clothed male body is found floating in a lake. Autopsy reveals abundant frothy fluid in airways, hyperinflated lungs, and water in the stomach. The most likely cause of death is:
A body is found in water with both hands clenched, and fingers grasping weeds. This finding is known as:
A woman is found dead with nail marks around her neck, bilateral conjunctival petechiae, and adduction fractures of the hyoid bone. The most likely cause of death is:
A prisoner is found dead in a locked room with a towel tightly wrapped around his neck. Autopsy shows a deep horizontal ligature mark with no fracture of hyoid. The likely cause is:
A man is shot in the chest. The entry wound has blackening, tattooing, and a circular abrasion collar. The probable distance of fire is:
A pedestrian hit by a car presents with tibial fractures, pelvic injuries, and skull trauma. What is the most likely injury pattern?
A farmer is found unconscious with pinpoint pupils, excessive salivation, and fasciculations. The most likely cause is:
A patient presents with cherry-red discoloration of the skin, normal pupils, and breath that smells like bitter almonds. What is the most likely poisoning?
A man is found dead with pink hypostasis, bright red blood, and no signs of external injury. The most probable cause of death is:
A body found in a marshy area exhibits adipocere formation. The minimum time required for this change to occur is:
A patient was last seen alive 15 hours ago. The body shows full rigor mortis, fixed livor mortis, and mild corneal clouding. What is the most probable time of death?
A bullet retrieved from an autopsy has distorted rifling marks, suggesting it struck another surface before hitting the body. What is the most likely wound pattern on the victim?
A 25-year-old man involved in a head-on car collision presents with transverse fractures of the sternum and rib fractures at multiple sites. What is the most likely mechanism of injury?
A motorcyclist involved in a crash has an extensive degloving injury on the thigh, with underlying muscle exposure and asphalt embedded in the wound. This injury is best classified as:
A body of a child is found with a patterned bruise resembling a belt buckle. What is the most likely cause of injury?
A boxer collapses in the ring after receiving multiple punches to the head. Autopsy reveals a subdural hematoma without skull fractures. What is the most likely mechanism of injury?

A revolver is recovered from a crime scene. The suspect claims that the gun accidentally discharged while he was cleaning it. Which of the following findings on the firearm would help establish whether the shot was intentional?
A bullet is retrieved from a victim’s body and is found to be fully jacketed. Which of the following is true regarding its behavior in tissue?

options.label: B
options.text: It causes cavitation and extensive tissue destruction

options.label: C
options.text: It penetrates deeper with less deformation

questions.correct_answer: C. It penetrates deeper with less deformation

questions.text: A woman presents with heavy vaginal bleeding following an attempted abortion using herbal medicines. Examination reveals uterine perforation. What is the most appropriate medico-legal classification of this case?
A couple undergoes surrogacy in India under the Surrogacy (Regulation) Act, 2021. Which of the following conditions must be met for legal surrogacy?

options.label: A
options.text: The surrogate must be under 25 years old

options.label: B
options.text: The surrogate must have at least one biological child

options.label: C
options.text: The surrogate is allowed commercial compensation

options.label: D
options.text: The couple can choose an anonymous surrogate

questions.correct_answer: B. The surrogate must have at least one biological child

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, hematemesis, and black tarry stools. He accidentally ingested a chemical used for toilet cleaning. On examination, black charred lesions are seen in the oral cavity. Which poison is most likely responsible?

A patient with a history of household cleaning agent ingestion presents with dysphagia and severe retrosternal pain. A barium swallow shows a long, narrow esophageal stricture. Which of the following was the most likely poison?

A 7-year-old child from a slum area presents with irritability, abdominal pain, and constipation. On examination, the gums show bluish pigmentation, and wrist drop is noted. Peripheral smear shows basophilic stippling of RBCs. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A rice farmer presents with excessive salivation, garlic odor in breath, and hematuria. He reports working in fields treated with pesticides. Urine examination shows high arsenic levels. What is the best treatment?

A 22-year-old factory worker accidentally ingested rat poison containing yellow phosphorus. He was initially asymptomatic but developed jaundice and coagulopathy after 48 hours. What is the best next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate gastric lavage with potassium permanganate

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediate gastric lavage with potassium permanganate

questions.text: A 45-year-old firefighter develops severe breathlessness, pulmonary edema, and hypotension after exposure to smoke in a warehouse fire. He describes a musty hay-like odor at the scene. Which of the following gases is most likely responsible?

A factory worker exposed to an unknown gas presents with cherry-red discoloration of the skin and bright red arterial blood. Pulse oximetry shows normal oxygen saturation, but the patient is unconscious. Which of the following is the best initial treatment?

A 40-year-old man presents with confusion, metabolic acidosis, and visual disturbances described as "blurry vision with white spots." His family reports he consumed alcohol from an unregulated source. His blood analysis shows high anion gap metabolic acidosis. Which of the following is the best antidote?

A 25-year-old alcoholic is found unconscious. His breath has a fruity odor, and blood gas analysis reveals metabolic acidosis with an increased anion gap. Urinalysis shows calcium oxalate crystals. Which poison is responsible?

A 30-year-old man presents with episodic convulsions triggered by minimal stimuli, opisthotonus, and risus sardonicus. The patient was found unconscious in a field. Which of the following is the best management?
A 19-year-old college student is brought to the ER after ingesting a plant seed. He has dilated pupils, hallucinations, dry mouth, and urinary retention. What is the most likely poison?

A 28-year-old farmer presents with salivation, lacrimation, urination, diarrhea, miosis, and muscle fasciculations. His family says he was spraying pesticides. What is the most appropriate first-line treatment?
A patient presents with organophosphate poisoning and receives excessive atropine. Which of the following would confirm atropine toxicity?
A 25-year-old man is bitten by a snake in rural India. He develops ptosis, dysphagia, and respiratory distress without significant local swelling. Which snake is most likely responsible?
A farmer presents with acute kidney injury and spontaneous bleeding after a snakebite. The 20WBCT (Whole Blood Clotting Time) is prolonged. What is the most probable venom type?

A 20-year-old student attempts suicide by ingesting aluminum phosphide (Celphos). He presents with intractable vomiting, severe metabolic acidosis, and refractory hypotension. Which of the following is a suggested antidote?
A patient presents with rapid-onset dyspnea, headache, and altered sensorium after being trapped in a closed room with a running generator. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old laborer presents with jaundice, peripheral neuropathy, and hyperpigmentation of the palms and soles. He has been drinking well water from a contaminated source for the last 10 years. What is the most probable cause?

A 50-year-old industrial worker with chronic exposure to mercury presents with intention tremors, irritability, and gingivitis. Which of the following tests is most specific for chronic mercury toxicity?
Which of the following war gases primarily inhibits cytochrome oxidase, leading to histotoxic hypoxia?
A forensic examination of a body reveals opisthotonus and risus sardonicus. The toxicology report confirms strychnine ingestion. What is the primary cause of death in such cases?

options.label: C
options.text: Asphyxia due to respiratory muscle paralysis

questions.correct_answer: C. Asphyxia due to respiratory muscle paralysis

questions.text: A 23-year-old man is brought unconscious to the emergency room after ingesting an unknown substance. He has pinpoint pupils, respiratory depression, and hypotension. What is the best immediate management?
What are the pecuniary powers of first-class judicial magistrate?
Which centre of ossification is not present at one year of age?
Body stuffer is a person who

options.label: A
options.text: Transports the drugs in the body

options.label: B
options.text: Distributes the drugs to the clients

options.label: C
options.text: Consumes the drugs for the fear of being caught

questions.correct_answer: C. Consumes the drugs for the fear of being caught

questions.text: Disputed maternity can be solved by using the following tests except:
Spinal cord is preserved in which poisoning
All are true for an incised wound except:

options.label: D
options.text: Length of injury does not correspond with length of the blade

questions.text: Sparrow marks are seen in?
In an emergency Medical termination of Pregnancy can be done

options.label: C
options.text: In a private hospital which is not recognized for MTP

questions.text: Which is true of cyanide poisoning

options.label: C
options.text: Fatal dose is 0.2gm of potassium cyanide

questions.correct_answer: C. Fatal dose is 0.2gm of potassium cyanide

questions.text: Diphtheria-like colitis with thickening of ascending colon and transverse colon is feature of which of the following toxicity?
A person whose family is abroad died suddenly. His viscera was preserved during post mortem examination. What may be found in the viscera even though the person may not have consumed it.
Antemortem abrasions can be confused with
Lacerated looking incised wound occurs over:
Permission of autopsy in case of road traffic accident is given by
The test banned by Supreme court of India, to opine whether the female is habituated to sexual intercourse is
White waxy material with preserved facial feature is seen in dead body found in water. What is true about this condition.

options.label: A
options.text: It needs hot weather without humidity

options.label: B
options.text: Is a way of preservation by saponification of fats

questions.correct_answer: B. Is a way of preservation by saponification of fats

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of antemortem contusion:
Ring fracture occurs due to:
In a bomb blast, the patient dies due to Myocardial infarction. This would be classified as what type of blast injury
All can cause Traumatic asphyxia except:

Commonest site of injury to spinal cord in Judicial hanging
Opinion regarding potency of a man with normal genitalia is worded as:

options.label: B
options.text: The individual is capable of sexual act

options.label: C
options.text: There is nothing to suggest that the person is not capable of performing sexual intercourse

options.label: D
options.text: No definite opinion can be given

questions.correct_answer: C. There is nothing to suggest that the person is not capable of performing sexual intercourse
